docs.title: Social Media Downloader
docs.text:
Welcome to the official documentation for Social Media Downloader — a fast, simple, and open-source command-line tool to download public videos from your favorite social media platforms, including YouTube, TikTok, Facebook, Instagram, and more.

Important

This documentation is here to help you get started, troubleshoot any issues, explore use cases, and even contribute to improving the project.

docs.title: Why Social Media Downloader?
docs.text:
In today’s world, media moves fast — and so do you. Whether you're a developer, content creator, researcher, or just someone who wants a fast way to save public videos for offline viewing, Social Media Downloader is built to do one thing really well: download media reliably and fast from a wide range of platforms.

Here’s why thousands of users trust this tool:

  • Available as .exe, Linux binary, and .deb packages
  • Built with ❤️ using Python and designed for simplicity
  • 100% free and open-source
  • Cross-platform (Windows & Linux)
  • No bloated GUIs, just clean CLI power

docs.title: What You Get
docs.text:
When you install Social Media Downloader, you're getting:

  • A simple command-line interface (CLI) that works out of the box.
  • Automatic format detection and download options.
  • Lightweight performance without third-party junk.
  • Easy integration into your own scripts or automation.

docs.title: Supported Platforms
docs.text:
We currently support public video links from the following:

  • YouTube
  • TikTok
  • Instagram
  • Facebook
  • X
  • & many more! See the full list of supported platforms for details.

We’re adding more regularly — and you can suggest new platforms by opening an issue or pull request!

Tip

Our flexible architecture means adding new platform support is as easy as writing a handler module. Developers, come contribute!

docs.title: Easy Installation
docs.text:
We offer builds for all major platforms:

Download the .exe, smd-linux.tar.gz & .deb from Releases or see Archive for older versions. And we’ll keep it updated for you. We also have a page where you can see download only latest releases.

Platform Format How to Install Windows .exe Download the .exe and run directly Linux .tar.gz Extract and run binary directly Debian .deb Download the .deb sudo dpkg -i social-media-downloader_VERSION_amd64.deb

Warning

Make sure you download only from the official GitHub releases. Third-party downloads may not be secure.

docs.title: 🫗 Build Instructions
docs.text: Want to turn Social Media Downloader into a standalone executable? Whether you're building for Windows or Linux, this guide will walk you through everything you need using PyInstaller.

docs.title: Install PyInstaller
docs.text:
First, make sure you have PyInstaller installed. It converts your Python scripts into standalone executables for easy distribution — no Python installation required on the end user’s system.

pip3 install pyinstaller

docs.title: Building on Windows
docs.text: You’ve got a few options depending on how you want your executable to behave:

docs.title: Console Version
docs.text:
This version will open a terminal/console window when run.

pyinstaller --onefile smd/downloader.py

docs.title: Silent Version (No Console Window)
docs.text:
If you want to hide the terminal window (for example, when launching from a desktop shortcut or GUI), use:

pyinstaller --onefile --noconsole smd/downloader.py

docs.title: With a Custom Icon
docs.text:
Want a polished feel? Add your own .ico file to give the executable a custom icon:

pyinstaller --onefile --icon=assets/logo.ico smd/downloader.py

Important

Make sure your icon file is in .ico format. If you’re using .png, you can convert it using an online tool or image editor.

After the build completes, your .exe file will be located in the dist/ folder.

docs.title: Building on Linux
docs.text:
Building on Linux is just as straightforward. Run:

pyinstaller --onefile smd/downloader.py

Once the build finishes, make the output binary executable:

chmod +x dist/downloader
./dist/downloader

You now have a portable binary that can run on any compatible Linux system.

docs.title: Font Issues?
docs.text:
Tip

If you're seeing missing fonts or broken ASCII art from pyfiglet, head over to the Troubleshooting page for help resolving that.

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
By default, PyInstaller creates two folders:

  • dist/ — contains your final executable
  • build/ — temporary build files (you can usually delete this after packaging)

Your single-file executable will always be located in the dist/ directory.

docs.title: Clean Up (Optional)
docs.text:
Want to clean the extra files after a build?

rm -rf build __pycache__ *.spec

This will leave you with just your source code and the dist/ folder containing your binary.

You're now ready to distribute your own standalone version of Social Media Downloader!

Tip

Need .deb or other platform-specific packages? Stay tuned for packaging instructions in the future or check out our Release Archive.

docs.title: Configuration File: config.json
docs.text:
When you run Social Media Downloader for the first time, the CLI automatically generates a configuration file called config.json. This file stores your personal tool settings and preferences locally.

Note

The config file is created in the same directory where you launch the CLI. We recommend running the tool from your Desktop to keep things tidy. You can always customize the config later.

docs.title: Default Configuration
docs.text:
Here’s what the default config.json looks like:

{
  "default_format": "show_all",
  "download_directory": "media",
  "history_file": "download_history.csv",
  "mp3_quality": "192"
}

docs.title: Key Settings Explained:
docs.text: Key Description default_format Format selector — can be set to mp4, mp3, or show_all (default option) download_directory Folder where downloaded files will be saved. Default is media/ history_file CSV file to log your download history. Helps you track what you've downloaded mp3_quality Bitrate quality (in kbps) for MP3 audio downloads. Default is 192

docs.title: Customizing Your Settings
docs.text: You can open and edit the config.json manually in any text editor (like VS Code, Notepad, etc.).

docs.title: Example Changes:
docs.text:
Want to download only MP3s to your Downloads folder at 320kbps? Your config might look like:

{
  "default_format": "mp3",
  "download_directory": "C:/Users/YourName/Downloads",
  "history_file": "download_history.csv",
  "mp3_quality": "320"
}

Tip

Make sure the folder you specify in download_directory exists — the tool won’t create nested directories automatically.

docs.title: Additional Files Created Automatically
docs.text:
When you run the tool, it also creates these helpful files in the same directory:

File Name Purpose config.json Stores your settings media/ Default folder where downloaded files are saved download_history.csv Tracks all your downloads for easy reference downloader.log Stores runtime logs and errors (useful for debugging)

docs.title: No User Tracking
docs.text:
Social Media Downloader does not track or store any personal data. All files, logs, and configs are kept locally on your machine. Nothing gets sent to any server.

Important

If you ever want to reset your settings, just delete the config.json file and it will be re-generated the next time you run the tool.

docs.title: ❓ Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text: Welcome to the FAQ section for Social Media Downloader! Here, we've compiled answers to the most common questions to help you get the most out of our tool.

docs.title: 1. What is Social Media Downloader?
docs.text: Social Media Downloader is a command-line tool designed to download public videos, reels, and posts from platforms like YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, and more. It's lightweight, open-source, and supports batch downloads, making it a versatile choice for users across different operating systems.

docs.title: 2. Which platforms are supported?
docs.text:
Currently, the tool supports downloading content from:

  • YouTube
  • TikTok
  • Instagram
  • Facebook

and See the Supported Platforms page for more details. We're continually working to expand support to more platforms in future updates.

docs.title: 3. Is the tool free to use?
docs.text: Absolutely! Social Media Downloader is open-source and completely free. You can view, modify, and distribute the code under the terms of the MIT License.

docs.title: 4. Does it support downloading private or password-protected content?
docs.text: No. The tool is designed to download public content only. It does not support downloading private or password-protected videos, ensuring compliance with platform policies and user privacy.

docs.title: 5. How do I install the tool?
docs.text:
You can install Social Media Downloader using pip:

pip install social-media-downloader

Alternatively, you can clone the repository:

git clone https://github.com/nayandas69/Social-Media-Downloader.git
cd Social-Media-Downloader

For detailed installation instructions, refer to the Installation Guide.

docs.title: 6. How do I use the tool after installation?
docs.text:
After installation, you can run the tool using:

social-media-downloader

Or, if you have version 1.1.4 or later:

smd

Follow the on-screen prompts to enter the URL of the content you wish to download.

docs.title: 7. What file formats are supported for downloads?
docs.text: The tool supports downloading videos in various formats, including MP4 and MP3. You can choose the desired format during the download process.

docs.title: 8. Can I download multiple videos at once?
docs.text:
Yes! Social Media Downloader supports batch downloads, especially for platforms like Instagram. You can input multiple URLs, and the tool will process them sequentially.

Warning

Only support Instagram

docs.title: 9. Is there a graphical user interface (GUI) available?
docs.text: Currently, Social Media Downloader is a command-line tool and does not have a GUI. However, we're exploring the possibility of developing a GUI in future releases.

docs.title: 10. How do I update the tool to the latest version?
docs.text:
If you installed the tool using pip, you can update it using:

pip install --upgrade social-media-downloader

For other installation methods, refer to the Installation Guide for update instructions.

docs.title: 11. I'm encountering a "ModuleNotFoundError" related to pyfiglet fonts. How can I fix this?
docs.text:
This error occurs when PyInstaller misses the font files during the build process. To fix it:

  1. Create a spec file:
pyi-makespec --onefile smd/downloader.py
  1. Edit the generated downloader.spec file and add:
from PyInstaller.utils.hooks import collect_data_files
datas = collect_data_files("pyfiglet")
  1. Rebuild the executable:
pyinstaller downloader.spec

For more details, refer to the Troubleshooting Guide.

docs.title: 12. Does the tool work on both Windows and Linux?
docs.text: Yes! Social Media Downloader is cross-platform and works seamlessly on both Windows and Linux systems. We provide .exe files for Windows and binaries or .deb packages for Linux.

docs.title: 13. Is there a way to contribute to the project?
docs.text: Absolutely! We welcome contributions from the community. You can fork the repository, make your changes, and submit a pull request. For more details, check out the Contribute Guide.

docs.title: 14. How can I report bugs or request new features?
docs.text: You can report issues or request features by opening an issue on our GitHub Issues Page. Please provide detailed information to help us address your concerns effectively.

docs.title: 15. Is there a changelog available to track updates?
docs.text: Yes, we maintain a Changelog that lists all the updates, improvements, and bug fixes in each version.

docs.title: 16. Are there any legal considerations I should be aware of?
docs.text: Yes. Social Media Downloader is intended for downloading public content for personal use. Downloading copyrighted material without permission may violate laws in your jurisdiction. Always ensure you have the right to download and use the content.

docs.title: 17. Can I use the tool without installing Python?
docs.text: Yes! For users who prefer not to install Python, we provide standalone executables (.exe for Windows and binaries for Linux) that can be run directly. Check out the Releases Page for the latest versions.

docs.title: 18. How do I uninstall the tool?
docs.text:
If you installed the tool using pip, you can uninstall it using:

pip uninstall social-media-downloader

For other installation methods, refer to the Installation Guide for uninstallation instructions.

docs.title: 19. Does the tool support downloading stories or live videos?
docs.text: Currently, Social Media Downloader focuses on downloading standard posts and videos. Support for stories and live videos is not available at this time.

docs.title: 20. Where is the downloaded content saved?
docs.text: By default, all videos and audio files are saved in a folder named media, which is automatically created in the current directory when you run the CLI. You can change this folder by editing the "download_directory" value in the config.json.

docs.title: 21. What is config.json and what does it do?
docs.text:
The config.json file is automatically created the first time you run Social Media Downloader. It stores key settings like:

{
  "default_format": "show_all",
  "download_directory": "media",
  "history_file": "download_history.csv",
  "mp3_quality": "192"
}

Here’s what each field means:

  • default_format: Controls the default download behavior (e.g., show all formats or auto-select best).
  • download_directory: The folder where all your media gets saved. It's automatically created if it doesn't exist.
  • history_file: Keeps a log of everything you've downloaded in .csv format — useful for tracking and avoiding duplicates.
  • mp3_quality: Controls the bitrate of MP3 audio (default is 192 kbps). You can increase this to "256" or "320" for higher audio quality.

Danger

When you run the tool from a new or different path, it will automatically create a fresh config.json, media folder, and download_history.csv. If you're just starting out, we recommend running it from your Desktop so everything stays organized. You can always open config.json and customize settings like download_directory, default_format, or mp3_quality later on.

The best part? This app doesn’t send or track any of your data — everything is stored locally, and you're always in control.

docs.title: 22. What is config.json and where can I find it?
docs.text: config.json is an auto-generated configuration file that appears when you first run the tool. It contains default settings like download location, MP3 quality, and history tracking. It lives in the same folder as your downloader.py or executable.

docs.title: 23. Can I change the default MP3 quality?
docs.text:
Yes! Open config.json and modify the "mp3_quality" field. The default is "192", but you can set it to a higher bitrate like "256" or "320" for better audio fidelity.

"mp3_quality": "320"

Make sure you have ffmpeg installed, as it handles the audio conversion.

docs.title: 24. What does download_history.csv do?
docs.text: This file keeps track of everything you’ve downloaded using the CLI — including URLs, timestamps, and formats. It helps avoid downloading the same link twice and gives you an audit trail for your activity.

docs.title: 25. What’s inside downloader.log?
docs.text: That’s the logging file! If the tool crashes or something doesn’t work, check downloader.log. It captures error messages, failed downloads, and other useful debug information that can help you or developers fix bugs.

docs.title: 26. Does this tool collect or track any personal data?
docs.text: No. Social Media Downloader is 100% local. It doesn't send your URLs, history, or any information to a server. There’s no backend, no analytics, no tracking — everything is stored on your own machine.

docs.title: 27. Can I use this tool offline?
docs.text: Yes, partially. Once the dependencies are installed and ffmpeg is available locally, you can use the tool to download videos as long as you have internet access for the video sources. The tool itself doesn’t require an active connection to operate internally.

docs.title: 28. What libraries does this tool use?
docs.text:
The tool is built with powerful, open-source libraries:

  • yt-dlp: handles video downloads
  • instaloader: supports Instagram content
  • tqdm: for beautiful progress bars
  • requests: for HTTP calls
  • ffmpeg-python: for media conversion
  • tabulate, termcolor, pyfiglet: for better CLI experience

For the full list, check requirements.txt.

docs.title: 29. I’m concerned about dependencies. Is it safe?
docs.text: Yes, the dependencies used are from reputable sources and open-source communities. You can audit the code and even build the tool yourself from source if you’re extra cautious.

docs.title: 30. How do I build my own .exe or binary from source?
docs.text: You can follow our Build Instructions to package the tool into a standalone executable or binary for your system. We use GitHub Actions to generate releases, but you're encouraged to build locally if you prefer.

docs.title: 31. Why should I trust this project?
docs.text:
• Open-source under MIT License
  • No tracking, telemetry, or backend
  • All data is saved locally
  • You can inspect or modify the code freely
  • All binaries are auto-built with GitHub Actions — no hidden installers

docs.title: 32. I want to contribute, but I don’t know where to start?
docs.text: Check our Contributing Guide for simple steps to begin. You don’t need to be an expert — even fixing typos or improving documentation helps a lot!

docs.title: 33. Can I use a .txt file with multiple links?
docs.text: Absolutely! Just create a .txt file with one URL per line, and the CLI will read it and download each link sequentially. This works for Instagram supported .

docs.title: 34. How does the tool handle updates?
docs.text:
The tool includes a built-in update checker — not an auto-updater. When you run the CLI, it checks if a newer version is available by querying the GitHub Releases API. If an update exists, you'll see a message with the latest version and a link to download it.

However, you still need to update it manually. You can:

  • Pull the latest code from the GitHub repo if you're running from source:

git pull origin main
Or, if installed via pip, update with:

pip install social-media-downloader --upgrade
* If you're using the .exe, binary, or .deb versions of the tool, make sure to manually download the latest release from the Releases page.

Note

The update check only runs if you're connected to the internet. It won't download or install anything automatically.

docs.title: 35. Can I use this in a Docker container?
docs.text: Currently, it’s not officially Dockerized — but you're welcome to create your own Docker setup using the Python environment. Just be sure to include ffmpeg.

docs.title: 36. Does it work on ARM-based systems (e.g. Raspberry Pi)?
docs.text: Yes, as long as Python and ffmpeg are available for your architecture, you should be able to run the tool. Use the Python script version, not a Build Artifacts binary.

docs.title: 37. Can I change the output filename format?
docs.text: Not directly right now. However, feel free to modify the naming logic in the Python source if you want to customize filenames based on date, title, or platform.

docs.title: 38. Is it safe to run as root/admin?
docs.text: There's no need to run the tool with elevated privileges. It works perfectly in normal user mode. Only use sudo if installing system-wide dependencies like ffmpeg.

docs.title: 39. Can I download entire playlists or user channels?
docs.text: Not yet — currently, the tool supports single video URLs or batch links via .txt. Playlist and channel support may come in future versions.

docs.title: 40. How do I get support?
docs.text:
• For bugs: open an Issue
  • For questions: visit the Discussions
  • For general help: check the Troubleshooting Guide

Need more help? Don’t hesitate to reach out — the community’s here to support you. We hope this FAQ section helps you navigate and utilize Social Media Downloader effectively. Happy downloading!

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Let’s get you up and running with Social Media Downloader — a powerful command-line tool to grab public videos from platforms like YouTube, TikTok, and more.

Follow the steps below to set up the project locally on your system.

docs.title: Clone the Repository
docs.text:
Start by cloning the official GitHub repository to your local machine:

git clone https://github.com/nayandas69/Social-Media-Downloader.git
cd Social-Media-Downloader

docs.title: Set Up the Python Environment
docs.text:
Tip

We recommend using Python 3.8+ and setting up a virtual environment to keep things clean and organized.

docs.title: On Windows
docs.text:
python -m venv venv
venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
python smd/downloader.py

docs.title: On Linux
docs.text:
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip3 install -r requirements.txt
python3 smd/downloader.py

docs.title: Install ffmpeg (Required)
docs.text:
Important

The downloader relies on ffmpeg to process video and audio. Make sure it's installed and added to your system’s PATH.

Here’s how to install it:

docs.title: On Windows
docs.text:
• Download from: https://ffmpeg.org/download.html
  • Extract the ZIP
  • Add the bin folder to your PATH environment variable

docs.title: On Linux
docs.text:
sudo apt update
sudo apt install ffmpeg

To confirm installation:

ffmpeg -version

If you see the version info, you’re good to go!

docs.title: You’re Ready!
docs.text:
Now you can start downloading:

python3 smd/downloader.py

That’s it — you’ve set up the Social Media Downloader!

Tip

Want to use the Build Artifacts .exe, .tar.gz, or .deb instead of building manually? Visit the Release Archive.

Facebook ✅ Yes ✅ Yes Only videos. X (Twitter) ✅ Yes ✅ Yes Only videos. Twitch ✅ Yes ✅ Yes Only videos. Snapchat ✅ Yes ✅ Yes Public spotlight videos. Reddit ✅ Yes ✅ Yes Only videos. docs.title: MP3 Audio Support
docs.text:
• MP3 download is supported for all platforms that offer a valid video stream.
  • Converts video to audio using internal tools — no extra steps needed.
  • Example: Downloading a YouTube video as .mp3 is fully supported.

docs.title: Multi-Link Support
docs.text:
Danger

Only supported Instagram. You can download multiple links at once in batch mode using a .txt file.

How it works:

  1. Create a .txt file with one URL per line (example: links.txt)
  2. Run the downloader and provide the file path when prompted.
  3. The downloader will process each link one by one.

Important

  • Only public content is supported — no private/locked/paid videos.
  • If you want to improve a platform's support, check our Contributing Guide.
  • All binaries (EXE, .deb, etc.) are built via GitHub Actions. If you want to improve packaging, update the CI workflow.

docs.title: 🛠️ Troubleshooting
docs.text: Ran into a hiccup while building or running Social Media Downloader? No worries — here’s how to fix the most common issue related to PyFiglet fonts when using PyInstaller.

docs.title: Problem: Missing PyFiglet Fonts
docs.text:
If you see an error like this when you run the executable:

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'pyfiglet.fonts'

Note

This happens because PyInstaller doesn't automatically bundle the font files that pyfiglet uses internally.

Without these fonts, your fancy ASCII banners won’t show up, and the script will crash on launch. Let’s fix that.

docs.title: Solution: Manually Include the Font Data
Step 1: Generate a .spec File
docs.text:
Run this command to generate a basic .spec file for your project:

pyi-makespec --onefile --icon=assets/logo.ico smd/downloader.py

This will create a file called downloader.spec.

docs.title: Step 2: Edit the Spec File
docs.text:
Open downloader.spec in your code editor and replace its content with the following:

# -*- mode: python ; coding: utf-8 -*-

from PyInstaller.utils.hooks import collect_data_files

datas = collect_data_files("pyfiglet")

a = Analysis(
    ['smd/downloader.py'],
    pathex=[],
    binaries=[],
    datas=datas,
    hiddenimports=[],
    hookspath=[],
    hooksconfig={},
    runtime_hooks=[],
    excludes=[],
    noarchive=False,
    optimize=0,
)

pyz = PYZ(a.pure)

exe = EXE(
    pyz,
    a.scripts,
    a.binaries,
    a.datas,
    [],
    name='downloader',
    debug=False,
    bootloader_ignore_signals=False,
    strip=False,
    upx=True,
    upx_exclude=[],
    runtime_tmpdir=None,
    console=True,
    disable_windowed_traceback=False,
    argv_emulation=False,
    target_arch=None,
    codesign_identity=None,
    entitlements_file=None,
    icon='assets/logo.ico',
)

What this does:

  • It tells PyInstaller to explicitly include all the font data from pyfiglet, so your executable has everything it needs to render text art properly.

docs.title: Step 3: Rebuild Using the .spec File
docs.text:
Now that your spec file is set up, rebuild the project using:

pyinstaller downloader.spec

This will package the fonts correctly and produce a working binary inside the dist/ folder.

docs.title: Final Result
docs.text:
After building, check inside the dist/ directory. You should now have a fully working standalone executable with no missing font errors — and your sweet ASCII art banners will look just the way they should.

Tip

Want more help customizing your build? Head over to the Build Instructions for extra tips on icons, silent mode, and cleanup options.

Got another error or issue? Feel free to open an issue on GitHub — we’re here to help.

docs.title: Usage Guide 🪴
docs.text: Ready to download videos like a pro? This guide will walk you through how to use Social Media Downloader in a variety of ways — from Python scripts to native .exe, .deb, and binary files.

docs.title: Running the Tool (Python Version)
docs.text:
If you’ve cloned the repo and set up your Python environment, you can launch the tool using:

python3 smd/downloader.py

The tool will start and prompt you for a public video URL — just paste the link, and the downloader will handle the rest!

Warning

This tool supports only public videos. Private or password-protected content is not supported.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Enter URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=example

Once you press Enter, the video will be processed and downloaded automatically.

docs.title: Using the .deb Package
docs.text: For Debian-based systems (like Ubuntu), we provide a Build Artifacts .deb package so you can install it just like any other app.

docs.title: Step-by-step:
docs.text:
1. Download the latest .deb file from the Releases page.
  2. Run the following command in your terminal:
sudo dpkg -i social-media-downloader_VERSION_amd64.deb
sudo apt-get install -f

This installs the tool system-wide. Now you can launch it directly with:

smd

That’s it — you’re good to go!

docs.title: Using the .exe
docs.text: On Windows, we offer a standalone .exe file that requires no setup.

docs.title: How to use:
docs.text:
1. Head to the latest release.
  2. Download the .exe file.
  3. Double-click it. A terminal window will open.
  4. Paste your video URL when prompted.

No Python, no installs — just click and run.

docs.title: Using the Linux Binary
docs.text: For other Linux distributions, you can grab the Build Artifacts binary file.

docs.title: Here’s how:
docs.text:
1. Go to the Releases page and download the zipped binary.
  2. Extract the archive.
  3. Navigate to the folder in your terminal and run:
chmod +x smd
./smd

Now you're running the tool natively on Linux!

docs.title: Installing via pip
docs.text:
You can also install the downloader as a global Python CLI tool using pip:

pip install social-media-downloader

Once installed, you can run the tool with:

social-media-downloader

or, on the latest version (v1.1.4 and up):

smd

docs.title: CLI Shortcuts: smd vs social-media-downloader
docs.text:
Starting from version 1.1.4, we've added a shorthand command to make your life easier:

  • social-media-downloader → Full command (works in all versions)
  • smd → Short and sweet (available from v1.1.4 onward)

Note

Earlier versions (1.0.0 to 1.1.3) do not support the smd shortcut. If you prefer using the short command, make sure you're on the latest version. That's only for pip.

docs.title: Pro Tip: Stay Updated
docs.text:
We’re always improving the tool, adding features, and making it even easier to use. Be sure to:

  • Check our Changelog for new features
  • Follow the GitHub Releases
  • Keep your version up-to-date for the latest improvements

Happy downloading!
